pullRequest.title: Modification in BuilderAi to pickup all needed ressources
pullRequest.bodyText:
Changes proposed in this pull request:

added ability to track multi stack items. ( bigger than stacksize. )
less walks for the Builder if its a large build
less buildtime
for review ... prepared testmap with birch townhall and all needed items available at..

https://github.com/lexustec/minecolonies-testmap
just start the townhall build and observe the inventory of the BuilderGuy
Review please

commit.message:
Change in BuilderAi to be a little bit more smart

Changed the System to reflect more proper requests if needed material is bigger than stacksize. and also to pick not only full stacks.. instead real values.

Change in BuilderAi to be a little bit more smart---still has a bug

Changed the System to reflect more proper requests if needed material is bigger than stacksize. and also to pick not only full stacks.. instead real values.
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/version/1.15' into version/1.15

Change in BuilderAi to be a little bit more smart

Bugfix... endless loop at bigger buildings
Merge branch 'version/1.15' into version/1.15

nodes.bodyText: I guess you can remove this here now.
guess you can roll back this change too
this comment can also go then I believe
nodes.diffHunk:

      * @param predicate the predicate to evaluate.
+     * @param stackInfo the actual stack of the predicate to get the needed value
      * @return true if succesful.
      */
-    private boolean tryTransferFromPosToWorker(final BlockPos pos, @NotNull final Predicate<ItemStack> predicate)

+    // modified to reflect the actual stack amount to transfer.  WIP

nodes.bodyText:
can you format this properly?
In the repo there is a formatting file for intellij you can setup to properly format this too.
I don't understand this change. If the worker has the item in the inventory, then it doesn't have to pick more up, ain't I right?

commit.message:
formatting change

fixed formatting

nodes.bodyText: If we're using BuildingBuilderResource here (not the builder class) we should change the name of the class

Is there a reason we need a tuple here?
From what i can tell the Integer is for how much of an item we need, except that an ItemStack can store the count of items, and no, it's not restricted to 64, can be any Int.

If this was done for debug, and it does nothing, then please remove it for live.
No need to keep it
put a final on here please
formatting (as ray said we have a formatting file)
import at top of file please

commit.message: Fix and format

Now it should be ready for review

Warehouse Inventory Total page working

The Warehouse got a new page which lists now all Warehouse connected Inventory. Icons still missing and window text is abstract for now. I didnt want to fuzz in the Language files for now. correct name needs to be found. Tech wise works nice. Ready for test

nodes.bodyText: Please adapt the format. While on top.
This is not a constant. Adapt formatting.
This need to be reworked. The logic here does not take stackability of items which are already contained in the inventory of the worker into account. Also formatting of while loops is of.

commit.message:
Happiness (#4651)

Complete happiness rework:

Added four different types of Happiness Modifiers.

Static: Depending statically on a value of the citizen
Time Based: Change factor over time
Expiration based: Invoked for a short time (buff for three days on a colonist death for example)
Client Sided: With the factor only for the client side.

All the lists in the GUI are now automatically generated from the list of modifiers.

Fixes

small changes,
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/version/1.15' into version/1.15

Feature/code smell (#4659)

Add a bit more doc
Fix some code smell
hotfix colony load issue

Update building itemStorage (#4661)

* Update building itemStorage
* hotfix #4649
